page.title: 03CRYNALLT JUNIOR SCHOOL 2
page.content: The school is situated on Afan Valley Road,Cimla, about one mile from the town of Neath.It is a modern school , opened on the 8th July,1954. A variety of building materials was used in the construction of the school. The main structure is brickwork , covered first with plaster and then a concrete rendering. The flat roof is protected with a layer of felt.The window frames are made from metal and the windows are single glazed.The interior and exterior door frames and doors are made from wood. There are 3 tarmacked play yards.At the side of one yard there is a patio.Plain and patterned breeze blocks were used to construct the patio together with concrete paving slabs for the floor.Woodblock flooring is used in classrooms and the hall.Stone and thermoplastic tiles are used elsewhere.
